Entries.9: If you want, our local mountains are excellent places to forage for mushrooms! Just be careful, some species are poisonous.

Entries.7_2: Many people don't like bats because they're vectors of disease.#$b#But they're very important to the ecosystem.#$e#Also, bats are adorable.$h
Entries.8_2: About one fifth of mammalian species are bats! They're the only mammals that can fly.$h
Entries.9_2: Bats are exceptionally long-lived for mammals. They'll often live three times longer than other similarly-sized mammals.$h
Entries.10_2: Sometimes I find these mushrooms when I explore around these mountains.[420]

Entries.7_2: In order to support the respiratory demands of flight, bats can actually exchange carbon dioxide for oxygen through their wings.$h#$e#Birds have evolved an extraordinary respiratory system, bats breathe through their wings. Isn't this marvelous?$h
Entries.10_2: Bat guano is commonly used as fertilizer! It's quite rich in nitrogen.
Entries.12_2: Bats help reduce the use of pesticides because they'll eat agricultural pests.$h
Entries.14_2: %Demetrius looks very tired.#$b#*Yawn*. Oh, hi, @, I was up late last night observing the bats in our local caves!

Entries.7_2: Compared to most mammals of their size, bats are incredibly long lived. I've always wondered how they managed.
Entries.15_2: Bats are far, far more capable of fighting off viruses than humans are.#$b#From rabies to coronaviruses, they seem far more capable of handling viruses than we are.
